narrative.narrative: Gill Airways was an airline based at Newcastle,England,UK from 1969 to September 20,2001. It began as a cargo and mail carrier and was called Gill Aviation. In 1989 it started passenger service and in 1995 changed to Gill Airways. Its passenger service was to Aberdeen,Scotland Belfast,Northern Ireland Dublin,Ireland Manchester,England London Gatwick,England Wick,Scotland and Jersey in the Channel Islands. It also had a codeshare with Air France on the Newcastle-Paris CDG route starting in 1995. The planes it used were Short 360's,Short 330's,Fokker 100's,BAe 146's and ATR 42-300's and ATR 72's. At the end its ATR fleet was four ATR 42-300's and at the start of 2000 it had seven ATR 72's but this number went down by 2001.
